content.rendered:
Give a little… gain a lot.

Offshore Wind Consultant’s (OWC) London team took a day out of the office advising the world’s wind farm developers last week, to help make a difference to a small charity in North West London.

“With our offshore wind market currently so busy, it is easy for one month to merge into the other and nearly a whole year will go past. It is important for us to say ‘stop’ and pause a little, and we decided to use this pause to do something different, together. We wanted to contribute something directly, and together as a team.”

Katherine Phillips OWC director and UK Country Manager

The Camden Society helps adults with a learning disability develop confidence and skills through horticulture at its charity garden centre.

The OWC team volunteered to improve the charities green living environmental wildlife roof, decorate the building and construct wooden shelving units to display plants grown from seed by the people the charity support.

“It was a really fun day doing something together that was completely different and knowing that you’re helping others” said Johan Coronado.

“I enjoyed meeting some of the people that charity helps,” said Ali Bonnon.“It felt very rewarding to be able to give something back and make a small difference.”

Michael, the charity manage was delighted with the efforts of the team. “I can’t thank you enough for what you achieved in a day. It would have taken us a month to do everything! It’s great to have our green roof back to life to help attract wildlife onto the site. Please come back again.”

Katherine Phillips was pleased with the team’s first experience of employee volunteering.“It was a fantastic day and something that we’ll definitely look to do again to help another local charity in 2020.”

The OWC team ended the day with a well-deserved trip to the pub to warm up and refuel on spent energy!

That’s CSR in action!

For further information, please contact:

Investors and financial media

Kim Boman, CFO, AqualisBraemar ASA
Telephone: +47 959 63 912

Other media enquiries

Endre Johansen, Corporate Communications AS
Telephone: +47 41 61 06 05
Email: endre.johansen@corpcom.no

About AqualisBraemar ASA

AqualisBraemar ASA (OSE: Aqua) is a public listed company that, through its subsidiaries and associates, offers adjusting, marine, offshore and renewables consultancy services to the energy, shipping and insurance industries. The group employs specialist engineers, naval architects, master mariners, loss adjusters and technical consultants in 48 offices located across 5 continents in 33 countries. AqualisBraemar ASA operates under three distinct brands globally:

  • AqualisBraemar: a leading adjusting, marine and offshore consultancy to the energy, shipping and insurance industries
  • AqualisBraemar Yacht Services: a specialised marine consultant to the superyacht market
  • Offshore Wind Consultants: an independent consultancy to the offshore renewables sector

jetpack-related-posts.title: Ambiens and OWC team up for Polish offshore wind developments
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has signed a memorandum of understanding with Polish environmental consulting firm Ambiens to cooperate on offshore wind developments in Poland.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar beefs up ports & harbours offering to tackle renewables rush
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar is set to ramp up its ports and harbours unit and combine resources and know-how with its offshore wind consultancy unit OWC, following a surge in assignments driven by renewable energy developments.

jetpack-related-posts.title: New MD for Offshore Wind Consultants
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Offshore Wind Consultants Ltd (OWC) promotes Will Cleverly to the role as managing director of the company.

jetpack-related-posts.title: INWED 2020 - Frances Pitkin
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: International Women in Engineering Day 2020 launches on June 23rd with the theme ‘Shape the World’. INWED, now in its seventh year, is a campaign that brings together engineers and their supporters from across the world, joining to raise awareness of the opportunities and achievements of women engineers.

jetpack-related-posts.title: INWED 2020 – Luany Dantas
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Luany Dantas is a Naval Architect and Marine Engineer in our Rio de Janeiro office. Her duties include Vessel Stability and Inclining Tests, Anchoring and Tow Plans, Structural Engineering, Marine Warranty.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC awarded Mayflower Wind framework agreement
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Mayflower Wind, the 50/50 joint venture between Shell and EDP Renewables, has awarded a framework agreement to offshore wind consultancy firm OWC for provision of engineering support to the US wind farm development.
